title: Editor's Choice Pictures
text:
Pictures | Wed Apr 25, 2018 | 11:55am EDT Editor's Choice Pictures
Inuka, Singapore's first born and bred polar bear undergoes a final check up at the Singapore zoo before it was put down. Wildlife Reserves Singapore/Handout via REUTERS Reuters / Wednesday, April 25, 2018 Inuka, Singapore's first born and bred polar bear undergoes a final check up at the Singapore zoo before it was put down. Wildlife Reserves Singapore/Handout via REUTERS Close 1 / 24
French President Emmanuel Macron (L) looks on as U.S. President Donald Trump flicks a bit of dandruff off his jacket during their meeting in the Oval Office following the official arrival ceremony for Macron at the White House in Washington.... more Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 French President Emmanuel Macron (L) looks on as U.S. President Donald Trump flicks a bit of dandruff off his jacket during their meeting in the Oval Office following the official arrival ceremony for Macron at the White House in Washington. REUTERS/Kevin Lamarque Close 2 / 24
Members of the Honourable Artillery Company fire a 62 gun salute from the Tower of London to welcome the birth of Prince William and Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge's third child, in London, Britain. REUTERS/Hannah McKay Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 Members of the Honourable Artillery Company fire a 62 gun salute from the Tower of London to welcome the birth of Prince William and Catherine, the Duchess of Cambridge's third child, in London, Britain. REUTERS/Hannah McKay Close 3 / 24
An ethnic Lisu man carries his crossbow as he poses for a photograph during a crossbow shooting competition in Luzhang township of Nujiang Lisu Autonomous Prefecture in Yunnan province, China. REUTERS/Aly Song Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 An ethnic Lisu man carries his crossbow as he poses for a photograph during a crossbow shooting competition in Luzhang township of Nujiang Lisu Autonomous Prefecture in Yunnan province, China. REUTERS/Aly Song Close 4 / 24
U.S. first lady Melania Trump visits the National Gallery of Art with her French counterpart Brigitte Macron in Washington. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 U.S. first lady Melania Trump visits the National Gallery of Art with her French counterpart Brigitte Macron in Washington. REUTERS/Brian Snyder Close 5 / 24
Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May speaks at the unveiling of the statue of suffragist Millicent Fawcett on Parliament Square, in London, Britain. REUTERS/Hannah McKay Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 Britain's Prime Minister Theresa May speaks at the unveiling of the statue of suffragist Millicent Fawcett on Parliament Square, in London, Britain. REUTERS/Hannah McKay Close 6 / 24
Models wait backstage before designer Fernanda Yamamoto REUTERS/Nacho Doce Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 Models wait backstage before designer Fernanda Yamamoto REUTERS/Nacho Doce Close 7 / 24
Damage caused by fire from a burning illegal oil well is seen in Ranto Peureulak, Aceh Province, Indonesia. Antara Foto/Rahmad/ via REUTERS Reuters / Wednesday, April 25, 2018 Damage caused by fire from a burning illegal oil well is seen in Ranto Peureulak, Aceh Province, Indonesia. Antara Foto/Rahmad/ via REUTERS Close 8 / 24
 drive a car during drive a car during 9 / 24
A 10 / 24
A private security guard blocks the camera to avoid being photographed at a new section of bollard wall in Santa Teresa, New Mexico, as seen from the Mexican side of the border in San Jeronimo, on the outskirts of Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose... more Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 A private security guard blocks the camera to avoid being photographed at a new section of bollard wall in Santa Teresa, New Mexico, as seen from the Mexican side of the border in San Jeronimo, on the outskirts of Ciudad Juarez, Mexico. REUTERS/Jose Luis Gonzalez Close 11 / 24
A general view shows the interior of the Peace House, the venue for the inter-Korean summit, at the truce village of Panmunjom inside the demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas, South Korea. Yonhap via REUTERS Reuters / Wednesday, April 25, 2018 A general view shows the interior of the Peace House, the venue for the inter-Korean summit, at the truce village of Panmunjom inside the demilitarized zone separating the two Koreas, South Korea. Yonhap via REUTERS Close 12 / 24
Mourners attend a makeshift memorial a day after a van struck multiple people along a major intersection in north Toronto, Ontario, Canada. REUTERS/Carlo Allegri Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 Mourners attend a makeshift memorial a day after a van struck multiple people along a major intersection in north Toronto, Ontario, Canada. REUTERS/Carlo Allegri Close 13 / 24
A tour group looks at 'The Golden Rule Mosaic', a work based on a painting by Norman Rockwell as they visit United Nations Headquarters Tuesday, April 24, 2018 A tour group looks at 'The Golden Rule Mosaic', a work based on a painting by Norman Rockwell as they visit United Nations Headquarters in New York City, New York. REUTERS/Mike Segar Close 14 / 24
Britain's Prince Harry and his fiancee Meghan Markle attend the Dawn Service at Wellington Arch to commemorate Anzac Day in London, Britain. REUTERS/Toby Melville/Pool Reuters / Wednesday, April 25, 2018 Britain's Prince Harry and his fiancee Meghan Markle attend the Dawn Service at Wellington Arch to commemorate Anzac Day in London, Britain. REUTERS/Toby Melville/Pool Close 15 / 24
Rafed, a man disabled by a landmine explosion, chats with friends in the village of Bitr, which in Arabic means "amputation", in Al-Tanouma district, east of Basra, Iraq. REUTERS/Essam Al-Sudani Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 Rafed, a man disabled by a landmine explosion, chats with friends in the village of Bitr, which in Arabic means "amputation", in Al-Tanouma district, east of Basra, Iraq. REUTERS/Essam Al-Sudani Close 16 / 24
Japanese Emperor Akihito (L) and Empress Michiko (2nd L) stand on a along with, (L-R) Crown Prince Naruhito, Crown Princess Masako, Prince Akishino, Princess Kiko, Princess Mako, Princess Nobuko, Princess Akiko, Princess Yoko, Princess Hisako,... more Reuters / Wednesday, April 25, 2018 Japanese Emperor Akihito (L) and Empress Michiko (2nd L) stand on a along with, (L-R) Crown Prince Naruhito, Crown Princess Masako, Prince Akishino, Princess Kiko, Princess Mako, Princess Nobuko, Princess Akiko, Princess Yoko, Princess Hisako, Princess Tsuguko and Princess Ayako, during the spring garden party hosted by the Emperor in Tokyo, Japan. Toshifumi Kitamura/Pool via Reuters Close 17 / 24
A model presents a creation from the Fernanda Yamamoto collection during the Sao Paulo Fashion Week, Brazil. REUTERS/Nacho Doce Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 A model presents a creation from the Fernanda Yamamoto collection during the Sao Paulo Fashion Week, Brazil. REUTERS/Nacho Doce Close 18 / 24
Commuters walk on a platform after they arrived at the Saint-Lazare train station in Paris during the tenth day of a nationwide strike by French SNCF railway workers in France. REUTERS/Philippe Wojazer Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 Commuters walk on a platform after they arrived at the Saint-Lazare train station in Paris during the tenth day of a nationwide strike by French SNCF railway workers in France. REUTERS/Philippe Wojazer Close 19 / 24
A worker cleans the premises of the 20th century Gaddi Baithak, which was damaged during the 2015 earthquake that killed around 9000 people, in Kathmandu, Nepal. REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar Reuters / Wednesday, April 25, 2018 A worker cleans the premises of the 20th century Gaddi Baithak, which was damaged during the 2015 earthquake that killed around 9000 people, in Kathmandu, Nepal. REUTERS/Navesh Chitrakar Close 20 / 24
Actor and comedian Bill Cosby departs after a day of closing arguments at his sexual assault retrial at the Montgomery County Courthouse in Norristown, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 Actor and comedian Bill Cosby departs after a day of closing arguments at his sexual assault retrial at the Montgomery County Courthouse in Norristown, Pennsylvania. REUTERS/Brendan McDermid Close 21 / 24
Milwaukee Bucks forward Giannis Antetokounmpo drives against Boston Celtics forward Jayson Tatum and guard Shane Larkin during the second quarter of game five of the first round of the 2018 NBA Playoffs at TD Garden in Boston. Mandatory Credit:... more Reuters / Tuesday, April 24, 2018 Milwaukee Bucks forward Giannis Antetokounmpo drives against Boston Celtics forward Jayson Tatum and guard Shane Larkin during the second quarter of game five of the first round of the 2018 NBA Playoffs at TD Garden in Boston. Mandatory Credit: Winslow Townson-USA TODAY Sports Close 22 / 24
Children play on a flooded highway during a summer downpour in Edsa, Quezon city, metro Manila. REUTERS/Dondi Tawatao Reuters / Wednesday, April 25, 2018 Children play on a flooded highway during a summer downpour in Edsa, Quezon city, metro Manila. REUTERS/Dondi Tawatao Close 23 / 24
Central American migrants, moving in a caravan through Mexico and traveling to request asylum in the U.S., wait before getting on a bus to travel from Hermosillo to Tijuana, in Sonora state Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Reuters / Wednesday, April 25, 2018 Central American migrants, moving in a caravan through Mexico and traveling to request asylum in the U.S., wait before getting on a bus to travel from Hermosillo to Tijuana, in Sonora state Mexico. REUTERS/Edgard Garrido Close
